comment._content: Whouh, it is the staircaise to heaven, good musik..

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: Typo in the title spelling of Château. If you look at the photos on Wiki en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch%C3%A2teau_de_Chambord you'll see that this is part of the roof, directly above the double helix staircase. The staircase is reputed to have been designed by Leonardo da Vinci for Francis I to enable the king to get visitors in and out of his apartments without meeting each other. The staircase is the same shape as the DNA double helix.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: It was in the news in April, 1915, when it was siezed by the French government as the property of an enemy of France. The chateau had become the property of the Duke of Parma, who in 1915 was Elias, Duke of Parma, who was then serving in the Austrian army. news.google.com/newspapers?id=1ostAAAAIBAJ&sjid=85wFA... Details of the litigation (which lasted until 1930) emanating from the sequestration of the chateau at en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elias,_Prince_of_Parma

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for catching the error, and providing more information about the castle.  We'll make the changes the next time we update the record.
